p: Rohu is cultured under semi-intensive polyculture system and is highly prestigious among other culturable carp species; therefore, it is highly demanded as food fish in Pakistan [ 29]. N. sativa is a native medicinal plant species, cultivated in almost all the provinces of Pakistan and, accordingly, it is cheaply available in local markets [ 30, 31, 32]. Therefore, the present study was undertaken to investigate the effects of dietary N. sativa supplementation on the growth performance, proximate composition, antioxidant and histo-biochemical parameters of rohu fingerlings.
